intro: Caperonia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf caper, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes. It is often found in temperate climates and is adapted to cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
